alert.note: Alert for Barton; Ellsworth; Lincoln; Russell (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 20 at 1:23AM CDT by NWS Wichita
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Lincoln, northwestern Ellsworth, southeastern Russell and Barton Counties through 145 AM CDT... At 122 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms scattered along a line extending from 12 miles northeast of Lincoln to near Pawnee Rock. Movement was east-northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Great Bend, Ellsworth, Hoisington, Ellinwood, Wilson, Claflin, Kanopolis, Lincoln, Holyrood, Pawnee Rock, Albert, Beverly, Lorraine, Olmitz, Susank, Westfall, Great Bend Airport, Ellsworth Airport, Cheyenne Bottoms and Odin. This includes Interstate 70 between Mile Markers 203 and 234. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 700 AM CDT for central Kansas.
